intro: Shuteria vestita f. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved shuteria, is a rare variant of the shuteria plant. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless foliage, which distinguishes it from the typical form. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic herbs and vegetables. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
